definition: to act arbitrarily/to make decisions without consulting others
for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: I think that it is arbitrary.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得这个是主观专断。

sentences.english: But that's arbitrary from a moral point of view.
sentences.chinese: 那是一种道德看法的专断。

sentences.english: To prevent the tendency to make decision arbitrarily and go their own way and oppose the defiance of orders and prohibitions.
sentences.chinese: 防止个人专断和各自为政，反对有令不行，有禁不止。

definition: to decide and act alone (idiom); to take arbitrary action/a law unto oneself
to decide and act alone (idiom); to take arbitrary action/a law unto oneself
centralized power (history), e.g. under an Emperor or party
